author: ligi42
content:
wondering the following: 
  1559 states:
     We introduce a new EIP-2718 transaction type, with the format 0x02 || rlp([chainId, nonce, maxPriorityFeePerGas, maxFeePerGas, gasLimit, to, value, data, access_list, signatureYParity, signatureR, signatureS]).

2930 states:

author: ligi42
content: We introduce a new EIP-2718 transaction type, with the format 0x01 || rlp([chainId, nonce, gasPrice, gasLimit, to, value, data, access_list, yParity, senderR, senderS]).

author: ligi42
content: so the signature variables are different. IMHO it would be better to be consistent here

author: ligi42
content: I actually like the names in 1559 more. But as 2930 is final and 1559 is last call it would be better to change the 1559 one to the 2930 style naming?

author: sky.cactus
content: Renaming the variables would be a non-nocmative change, so allowed for a final EIP.  You would want to talk with the 2930 authors to propose changing them though.

author: ligi42
content: <@!211091239112671234> <@!273808422753796097> would you as authors of 2930 be OK with that change? I would make a PR in that case

author: holiman
content: I don't care, all the same to me, so that's approval from me I guess
